- When asked for lists, provide all available options from the HR policies.

content: What is the car loan

The car loan policy provides Saudi employees in managerial positions (level 4 and above) and those in development programs (SDP or HiPo) with a loan amounting to 48 times their transportation allowance, interest-free, for purchasing a new car. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=36]

For more details, you can refer to the HR document portal: https://intranet.company.com/hr-policies/Human_Resource_Policy_final_edition.pdf
What is the car loan

The car loan policy provides Saudi employees in managerial positions (level 4 and above) and those in development programs (SDP or HiPo) with a loan amounting to 48 times their transportation allowance, interest-free, for purchasing a new car. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=36]

For more details, you can refer to the HR document portal: https://intranet.company.com/hr-policies/Human_Resource_Policy_final_edition.pdf
What is the car loan

For more details, you can refer to the HR document portal: https://intranet.company.com/hr-policies/Human_Resource_Policy_final_edition.pdf
What is the car loan

The car loan policy provides Saudi employees in managerial positions (level 4 and above) and those in development programs (SDP or HiPo) with a loan amounting to 48 times their transportation allowance, interest-free, for purchasing a new car. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=36]

For more details, you can refer to the HR document portal: https://intranet.company.com/hr-policies/Human_Resource_Policy_final_edition.pdf
What is the remote work

Remote work policy allows employees to work from home up to 2 days a week, 5 days a month, except in special cases. Approval requires scheduling and coordination with the direct manager, and having a computer or tablet. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=59]
List all the policies.

Certainly! The policies available are:

1. Strategic Policies
2. Operational Policies
3. General Provisions
4. Special Cases Exceptions
5. Employee Treatment Equality
6. Confidentiality of the HR Manual
7. Hajj Participation Policy

Nursery allowance

The company provides a nursery allowance for female employees, up to a maximum of 10,000 SAR per child per financial year, for children aged from 2 months to 6 years. The allowance is prorated based on the child's age within the financial year. Additionally, the nursery allowance cannot be combined with the education allowance for the same child. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=24]

For more details, please refer to the HR portal: https://jusur.channels.com.sa/
What is the nursery allowance

The nursery allowance for female employees is up to a maximum of 10,000 SAR per child per financial year, for children aged from 2 months to 6 years. The allowance is prorated based on the child's age within the financial year and cannot be combined with the education allowance for the same child. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=24]

For more details, please refer to the HR portal: https://jusur.channels.com.sa/
Nursery allowance policy

ğŸ“Œ 1. Policy Overview â€“ The nursery allowance is provided to female employees for the care of their children.

ğŸ“Œ 2. Detailed Explanation â€“ The company grants a nursery allowance up to a maximum of 10,000 SAR per child per financial year. This allowance is for children aged from 2 months to 6 years. The amount is prorated based on the child's age within the financial year. The allowance cannot be combined with the education allowance for the same child. The allowance is granted after the probation period, prorated from the date of joining.

ğŸ“Œ 3. Exceptions & Special Cases â€“ The allowance is only for female employees and is not applicable if the employee is on internal secondment and the new company provides a similar allowance.

ğŸ“Œ 4. Actionable Steps â€“ 
1. Ensure eligibility by completing the probation period.
2. Submit the necessary documentation to HR.
3. The allowance will be prorated and disbursed accordingly.

ğŸ“Œ 5. Policy Reference & Support â€“ Refer to [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=24] and [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=25] for detailed policy information. For further assistance, visit the HR portal: https://jusur.channels.com.sa/
Hello
Hello! How can I assist you with your HR-related inquiries today?
What is the car loan

ğŸ“Œ 1. Policy Overview  
The car loan policy provides financial assistance to eligible employees for purchasing a new car.

ğŸ“Œ 2. Detailed Explanation  
- Eligibility: Saudi employees at administrative level 4 or higher, and employees in SDP or HiPo programs.
- Loan Amount: Up to 48 times the monthly transportation allowance, interest-free.
- Conditions: 
  - The car must be new (manufactured in the contract year or the year before/after).
  - Employees must not be on unpaid leave at the time of approval.
  - Monthly transportation allowance will be deducted until the loan is fully repaid.
  - The company does not cover costs related to insurance, fuel, maintenance, or registration.
  - Employees with a company car cannot apply until the lease ends and the car is returned.

ğŸ“Œ 3. Exceptions & Special Cases  
- The CEO has the authority to make exceptions, except for the approved amounts.
- Employees can apply for another car loan after repaying half of the initial loan.

ğŸ“Œ 4. Actionable Steps  
1. Ensure eligibility based on the policy criteria.
2. Submit a car loan request and agree to the terms and conditions.
3. Await approval and direct bank transfer of the loan amount.
4. Monthly deductions will be made from the transportation allowance.

ğŸ“Œ 5. Policy Reference & Support  
Refer to [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=36] and [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=37] for detailed policy information.

title: What is the COOP program policy

content: What is the COOP program policy

The COOP program policy is as follows:

ğŸ“Œ 1. Policy Overview  
The COOP program, also known as the Cooperative Training and Summer Employment Program, aims to attract university students for full-time on-the-job training.

ğŸ“Œ 2. Detailed Explanation  
- The program offers university students the opportunity to gain practical experience by working full-time at the company.
- Participants receive a fixed monthly incentive determined according to the annual budget allocations.

ğŸ“Œ 3. Exceptions & Special Cases  
- Not specified in the provided document excerpts.

ğŸ“Œ 4. Actionable Steps  
- University students interested in the program should apply through the company's HR portal or designated application process.
- Ensure all required documents and information are submitted accurately.

ğŸ“Œ 5. Policy Reference & Support  
Refer to [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=19] for detailed policy information.

Good evening! What can I do for you?
Vision of the company

The vision of the company is to be the primary driver of growth for the group by operating the largest and most profitable sales and distribution network, ensuring a leading customer experience. This vision emphasizes innovation, flexibility, and dedication to serving both customers and employees with the best possible solutions.

ğŸ“Œ Refer to [Vision and Strategy.pdf#page=1] for detailed description.

title: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?...

content: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?

You can take a Hajj leave for a duration of 5 working days, provided you have successfully completed your probation period. This leave should be connected with the Eid al-Adha holiday and can be split before and after the Eid al-Adha holiday. The total leave duration, including the Eid holiday, should be no less than 10 calendar days and no more than 15 calendar days. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=56]
what is Etisalat Flex amount

The Etisalat Flex amount varies based on the administrative level of the employee. Here are the details:

1. CEO and Level 1: 2,000 SAR
2. Level 2: 1,800 SAR
3. Level 3: 1,300 SAR
4. Level 4: 1,000 SAR
5. Level 5: 800 SAR
6. Non-Saudi employees (all levels): 400 SAR

These amounts represent the maximum bill limits for services such as mobile, landline, and home internet. Employees are responsible for any charges exceeding these limits. [Human Resource Policy final edition.pdf#page=35]

How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?

You can take 5 working days of paid leave for Hajj, provided you have successfully completed your probation period. This leave is granted once and must be connected to the Eid al-Adha holiday. The total leave, including Eid al-Adha, should be between 10 to 15 calendar days. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?

You can take 5 working days of paid leave for Hajj, provided you have successfully completed your probation period. This leave can be connected with the Eid al-Adha holiday and can be split before and after the Eid al-Adha holiday, with a total duration of not less than 10 days and not more than 15 calendar days, including the Eid holiday. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]

title: What is the support for buying a house ?

content: What is the support for buying a house ?

The support for buying a house is provided through the Housing Loan Support Program. Here are the key points:

1. **Eligibility**: Employees must be Saudi nationals
role: hold an official position within the organizational structure

id: 2. **Loan Details**: The company offers housing loan support once a year
version: subject to budget availability. The support includes various housing solutions such as residential land
title: housing units under construction
timestamp: and self-construction of housing units. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=41]

id: 3. **Financial Terms**: The company contributes to the first payment on behalf of the employee
version: covering 10% of the property's value or as determined by the Saudi Central Bank
entra_oid: 000 SAR. The company also covers the full loan installments (monthly interest and principal) for the sixth year. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=40]

id: 4. **Loan Limits**: The maximum support is equivalent to 60 basic salaries
version: with limits based on administrative level:

id: 5. **Special Conditions**: Employees with rare specialties or positions may receive direct support upon request
version: as determined by a committee led by the CEO. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=41]

id: 6. **Suspension of Support**: Support may be suspended if the employee takes unpaid leave or exceptional leave
version: or if their services with the company end. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=41]"
please refer to the HR policy documents or contact the HR department through the Employee Voice feature."

title: What is the support for buying a house ?

content: What is the support for buying a house ?

The support for buying a house is provided through the Housing Loan Support Program. This program offers housing loans to employees once through local banks. The support includes various housing solutions such as residential land, ready housing units (apartments, floors, villas), housing units under construction, and self-construction of housing units. The company contributes to the first payment on behalf of the employee, covering up to 10% of the property's value or as decided by the Saudi Central Bank, not exceeding 300,000 SAR. The company also bears the interest rate up to 3.5% annually, and any amount above this is borne by the employee. The maximum support amount varies by administrative level, with up to 3,000,000 SAR for the CEO and levels one and two, 2,000,000 SAR for level three, and 1,500,000 SAR for levels four and five. The program is executed once a year, depending on the budget availability. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=40-41]
What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward is designed to encourage achievement and foster a competitive spirit among employees. It is awarded under specific conditions:

1. Eligibility: It is granted to employees at the third administrative level or below.
2. Criteria: Employees must improve company services, increase revenue, enhance work procedures, or safeguard the company's financial interests.
3. Additional Contributions: It is also awarded for extra work or contributions to significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events.
4. Nomination: Employees are nominated by the sector's Vice President, and the total reward amount must not exceed the allocated budget.
5. Disciplinary Record: Employees must not have been disciplined in the current year unless the penalty has been revoked.
6. Types of Rewards: The reward can be a thank-you letter, a certificate of appreciation signed by the CEO, a commemorative gift up to 500 SAR, or in-kind gifts within the sector's budget.

For more details, refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28].

Hello
Good afternoon! How can I assist you?
What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward aims to encourage achievement and foster a competitive spirit among employees. It is awarded to employees at the third administrative level and below for improving company services, increasing revenues, enhancing work procedures, or safeguarding the company's financial interests. It can also be given for additional work or contributions towards significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events. The reward is nominated by the sector's Vice President and must not exceed the allocated budget. Employees must not have been disciplined in the past year unless the penalty has been revoked. Types of Excellence Reward include a thank-you letter, a certificate of appreciation signed by the CEO, a commemorative gift with a maximum value of 500 SAR, and in-kind gifts within the sector's budget. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28]

I'll address the synonym.
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
How many day can I take for annual leave

Employees at the fifth administrative level are entitled to 22 working days of paid annual leave per year. Employees at the fourth administrative level and above, who have completed 5 years or more of service, are entitled to 25 working days of paid annual leave per year. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
Remotely working

The remote work policy allows employees to work from outside the office during official working hours using approved tools and devices like mobile phones and laptops. Employees can work remotely for up to 2 days a week, totaling 5 days a month, except in special cases. Approval from the direct manager is required, and employees must have a computer to perform their tasks. The company may install software on devices used for remote work to ensure compliance with official working hours and cybersecurity requirements. Special cases, such as health conditions or natural disasters, may grant employees up to 30 days of remote work, subject to periodic review and necessary justifications. New employees can work remotely after 3 months, while executive positions can do so after 1 month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]

title: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?...

content: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?

You can take 5 working days of paid leave for Hajj, provided you have successfully completed your probation period. This leave must be connected to the Eid al-Adha holiday and can be split before and after the Eid holiday, with a total duration of 10 to 15 calendar days, including the Eid al-Adha holiday. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward aims to encourage achievement, foster competition, and instill this culture among company employees. It is awarded under the following conditions:

1. Eligibility: Granted to employees at the third administrative level or below.
2. Criteria: Awarded for improving company services, increasing revenue, enhancing work procedures, or safeguarding the company's financial interests.
3. Additional Contributions: Given for extra work or contributions to achieving significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events.
4. Nomination: Employees are nominated by the Vice President of the relevant sector.
5. Disciplinary Record: Employees must not have been disciplined in the current year unless the penalty has been expunged.
6. Types of Rewards:
   - Thank You Letter
   - Certificate of Appreciation signed by the CEO
   - Commemorative gift with a maximum value of 500 SAR
   - In-kind gifts within the sector's budget, calculated at the company's cost.

For more details, please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28].

title: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?...

content: How many days off I can take if I submit a Hajj leave request?

You can take up to 5 working days of paid Hajj leave, provided you have successfully completed your probation period. This leave must be connected to the Eid al-Adha holiday and can be split before and after the Eid holiday, with a total duration of no less than 10 days and no more than 15 calendar days, including the Eid al-Adha holiday. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=56]
Is there annual leave?

Yes, there is an annual leave policy. Employees are entitled to paid annual leave based on their administrative level and years of service. For example, fifth-level administrative employees receive 22 working days per year, while fourth-level and above employees with 5 or more years of service receive 25 working days per year. Annual leave must be taken within the year it is accrued, and employees cannot exchange it for cash. Leave scheduling should be coordinated with direct managers. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
Can I take half day

Yes, you can take a half-day leave. According to the HR policy, employees are allowed to request a half-day leave, which will be deducted from their annual leave balance. This leave can be taken during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday during Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]

What is the policy for shortage

What is the policy for lateness?

The policy for lateness is outlined in the Human Resource Policy document. It states that lateness refers to not attending a scheduled training session at the specified time. Employees are required to register their attendance at the start and end of their workday using the company's approved systems and applications. Penalties for lateness and deficiencies are applied according to the schedules of violations and penalties attached to the company's internal work regulations. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=56]
Who is the king of KSA
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
Is there a car loan

Yes, there is a car loan policy available for employees. The company provides a car loan to its employees who are in the fourth administrative level or higher, as well as employees enrolled in competency development programs (SDP or HiPo). The loan amount is equivalent to 48 times the transportation allowance, and it is interest-free for the purpose of purchasing a car. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=38]
What is the interest free loan

The interest-free loan, referred to as "Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø¶ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†" in the HR policy, is a financial amount granted to employees who are actively working in the company. This loan is repaid in monthly installments without any interest, deducted from the employee's salary at a certain percentage. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]
Iâ€™m eligible for the car loan

To be eligible for a car loan, you must meet the following criteria:

1. You must hold a formal position within the organizational structure or a position approved in workforce plans. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
2. You must have completed at least the probationary period with the company. Employees in the Competency Development Programs (SDP or HiPo) must complete a full year in the program successfully if they are below the fifth administrative level. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
3. The car loan is available to employees at the fourth administrative level and above, or those enrolled in the Competency Development Programs. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=10]
4. The loan amount is equivalent to 48 times the transportation allowance, without interest, for the purpose of purchasing a car. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=37]

Please ensure you meet these conditions before applying. If you have further questions or need assistance, please contact your HR department.
Sick leave

The sick leave policy provides employees with the following entitlements based on medical reports:

1. The first 30 calendar days of sick leave are paid in full.
2. The next 60 calendar days are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi Embassy in the country where the report was issued.
5. If an employee's illness exceeds 120 days within a year, their services may be terminated according to labor laws.
6. In cases of kidney dialysis, the Human Resources Fund covers the salary for dialysis days up to 13 days per month.

For more details, refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60].

Is there half day work in the policy ?

Yes, the policy allows for a half-day leave. Employees can request a half-day leave, which will be deducted from their annual leave balance. This leave can be taken during the first or last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first or last 3 hours of the workday during Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
is there a national day vaction

Yes, the policy provides for a fully paid vacation for the National Day of the Kingdom and the State's Foundation Day. If these days coincide with the weekly rest days, the vacation is granted on the preceding or following working day, depending on work requirements. If an employee works on these days, they are compensated with another day off within a month from the date. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=61]
What is the date for the national day vacation

The national day vacation is granted with full pay for the Kingdom's National Day and the State's Founding Day. If these days coincide with the weekly rest days, the vacation is given on the preceding or following workday, depending on work requirements. If an employee works on that day, they are compensated with another day off within a month from the date. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=61]
nursery allowances is available for all levels ?

Nursery allowances are specifically available for female employees. The company provides a nursery allowance up to a maximum of 10,000 SAR for children aged from 2 months to 6 years within the financial year. This allowance is subject to specific conditions, and it cannot be combined with the educational allowance for the same child. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=25]
Itâ€™s okay if I get the nursery allowance & educational allowance?

According to the HR policy, you cannot receive both the nursery allowance and the educational allowance for the same child. The nursery allowance is provided to female employees for childcare up to a maximum of 10,000 SAR per year for children aged between 2 months and 6 years. The educational allowance is granted for children studying from elementary to high school, provided they are enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom and are under 18 years old. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24] [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=25]
Is there a specific number of child for the nursery allowance?

The nursery allowance policy does not specify a limit on the number of children for whom the allowance can be claimed. Instead, it provides a maximum allowance of 10,000 SAR per financial year for children aged from 2 months to 6 years. The allowance is calculated proportionally based on the child's age within the financial year. Additionally, the policy states that the nursery allowance cannot be combined with the education allowance for the same child. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=25]
What is the leave type

The types of leave available according to the Human Resource Policy are:

1. Annual Leave
2. Marriage Leave
3. Paternity Leave
4. Maternity Leave
5. Bereavement Leave
6. Iddah Leave
7. Pilgrimage Leave
8. Half-Day Leave
9. Exam Leave
10. Sick Leave
11. Leave for Medical Appointments
12. Exceptional Leave
13. Transfer Leave
14. National Holidays Leave
15. Eid Holidays Leave
16. Sports and Cultural Participation Leave

Please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=61] for detailed policy information. If you have any questions, please reach out to HR.
What is the loans type ?

The types of loans available according to the HR policy are:

1. **Benevolent Grant**: Non-repayable financial grants given to employees or their dependents in case of the employee's death while employed. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]

2. **Benevolent Loan**: Interest-free loans provided to employees, repayable in monthly installments deducted from the employee's salary. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]

3. **Housing Loan Support Program**: A program offering housing loans to employees through local banks, available once. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]

4. **Car Loan**: Interest-free loans for employees at the fourth managerial level and above, repayable in monthly installments deducted from the employee's salary, intended for purchasing a car. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]

Please refer to the HR policy documents for detailed information.

title: How many day for annul leave

content: How many day for annul leave

The annual leave policy states that employees in the fifth administrative level are entitled to 22 working days of paid annual leave per year. Employees in the fourth administrative level and above, who have completed 5 years or more of service, are entitled to 25 working days per year. All employees must take their annual leave within the year it is due, and they cannot exchange it for cash or defer it. Leave scheduling should be coordinated with direct managers, and if an employee does not utilize their leave, the company has the right to schedule the annual leave days for them. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
Sick leave

The sick leave policy allows employees who provide a medical report from an approved entity to take sick leave when necessary. The leave is accumulated annually starting from the first day of sick leave as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid in full.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi embassy in the country where the report was issued.

If the employee's illness continues for more than 120 days within the year starting from the first sick leave, the employee's services may be terminated according to labor regulations. Additionally, in cases of dialysis, the Human Resources Fund covers the salary for dialysis days up to 13 days per month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
Maternity leave

Maternity leave is covered under the HR policy, which states that a female employee is prohibited from working for 6 weeks following childbirth. She has the right to extend her leave for an additional month without pay. If the employee gives birth to a sick child or a child with disabilities requiring continuous care, she is entitled to a one-month paid leave starting after the maternity leave, with the option to extend it for another month without pay. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=59]

Unpaid leave ?

Unpaid leave is a type of leave that the company may grant when work requirements allow and there are compelling reasons. The maximum duration of unpaid leave is 180 calendar days every two years. Before taking unpaid leave, employees must exhaust their annual leave balance. During unpaid leave, employees do not receive any salary or allowances and are responsible for paying social insurance contributions. Employees are eligible for unpaid leave after completing 12 months of continuous work. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=61]

ÙˆØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…. ÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠÙ…ÙƒÙ†Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ø³Ø§Ø¹Ø¯ØªÙƒ Ø¨Ø®ØµÙˆØµ Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø±Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ÙŠØ©ØŸ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙƒ Ø³Ø¤Ø§Ù„ Ù…Ø­Ø¯Ø¯ Ø£Ùˆ Ø§Ø³ØªÙØ³Ø§Ø± Ø­ÙˆÙ„ Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³Ø§ØªØŒ ÙŠØ±Ø¬Ù‰ ØªÙˆØ¶ÙŠØ­Ù‡ Ù„ÙƒÙŠ Ø£ØªÙ…ÙƒÙ† Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø³Ø§Ø¹Ø¯ØªÙƒ Ø¨Ø¯Ù‚Ø©.
Sick leave.

The sick leave policy allows employees who can prove their illness with a medical report from an approved entity to take sick leave when necessary. The leave is calculated cumulatively within a single sick year, starting from the first day of sick leave, as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid in full.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi Embassy in the country where the report was issued.

Additionally, if an employee's illness continues for more than 120 days, either continuous or intermittent, within the year starting from the first sick leave, the employee's services may be terminated according to labor laws. For dialysis cases, the Human Resources Fund covers up to 13 days per month for dialysis sessions. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]

How many level have in the company?

The company has five administrative levels, as outlined in the HR policy:

1. **First Level**: CEO and equivalents.
2. **Second Level**: General Managers and equivalents.
3. **Third Level**: Department Managers and equivalents.
4. **Fourth Level**: Section Managers and equivalents.
5. **Fifth Level**: Employees and experts.

Additionally, there is a category for non-Saudi employees across all levels. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=7]
In the fifth level, how many grade?
The fifth administrative level corresponds to employees and experts. The specific grade within this level is 27. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=54]

title: There is policy regarding half day

content: There is policy regarding half day

The policy allows employees to request a half-day leave, which will be deducted from their annual leave balance. This leave can be taken during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday during the month of Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]

What is IDDAH leave

IDDAH leave is a type of leave granted to a Muslim female employee whose husband has passed away. She is entitled to a fully paid leave for a period of at least 4 months and 10 days from the date of her husband's death. If she is pregnant during this period, she has the right to extend the leave without pay until she gives birth. However, she cannot benefit from the remaining IDDAH leave after giving birth. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=59]

Annual leave

The annual leave policy specifies the following:

1. Employees at the fifth administrative level are entitled to 22 working days of paid annual leave per year.
2. Employees at the fourth administrative level and above, who have completed 5 years or more of service, are entitled to 25 working days of paid annual leave per year.
3. All employees must take their annual leave within the year it is due, and they cannot exchange it for cash during their service. Leave scheduling should be coordinated with direct managers, and if an employee fails to utilize their leave, the company has the right to schedule the annual leave days for them.
4. The company records the annual leave balance at the beginning of the calendar year, allowing employees to use it at any time during the year. If an employee's service ends before the year's end, the leave is deducted proportionally from their entitlements.
5. The company determines the amount of leave that can be carried over based on the annual leave scheduling plan.
6. Upon termination of employment, employees are compensated for their accrued annual leave balance.

For more details, please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57] and [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=58].
Sick leave

The sick leave policy allows an employee who has a medical report from a company-approved entity to take sick leave as needed. The leave is accumulated annually, starting from the first day of sick leave, as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid in full.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi embassy in the country where the report was issued.

If the employee's illness continues for more than 120 days, either continuous or intermittent, within the year starting from the first sick leave, the employee's services are terminated according to labor regulations. For kidney dialysis cases, the Human Resources Fund covers the salary for dialysis days up to 13 days per month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
Sick leave

The sick leave policy allows an employee who proves illness with a medical report from a company-approved entity to take sick leave when necessary. The leave is calculated cumulatively within one sick year starting from the first day of sick leave as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are fully paid.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi Embassy in the country where the report was issued.

Additionally, if the employee's illness continues for more than 120 days, whether continuous or intermittent, during the year starting from the first sick leave, the employee's services are terminated according to labor laws. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
Sick leave

The sick leave policy allows employees to take sick leave upon presenting a medical report from an approved entity. The leave is calculated cumulatively within the same sick year, starting from the first day of sick leave as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid in full.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are paid at three-quarters of the salary.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are unpaid.
4. Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be authenticated by the Saudi embassy in the country where the report was issued.

Additionally, if the employee's illness extends beyond 120 days, either continuous or intermittent, within the year starting from the first sick leave, the employee's services may be terminated according to the labor law. In cases of kidney dialysis, the Human Resources Development Fund covers the employee's salary for dialysis days, up to 13 days per month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
How many Day I can get in month for working remotely
You can work remotely for a maximum of 5 days per month, with a limit of 2 days per week, unless there are special circumstances. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]

Type of leaves

The types of leave available according to the Human Resource Policy are:

1. Annual Leave
2. Marriage Leave
3. Paternity Leave
4. Maternity Leave
5. Bereavement Leave
6. Iddah Leave
7. Pilgrimage Leave
8. Half-Day Leave
9. Examination Leave
10. Sick Leave
11. Medical Appointment Leave
12. Accompanying Leave
13. Exceptional Leave
14. Transfer Leave
15. Eid Al-Fitr and Eid Al-Adha Leave
16. National Holidays Leave
17. Sports and Cultural Participation Leave
18. Language Learning Leave
19. Extended Channels Leave

For detailed policy information, please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=5] and other relevant pages. If you have any questions, please reach out to HR.

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60]
Accompany leave ?

Accompany leave, as outlined in the HR policy, allows an employee to take leave to accompany a family member (spouse, children, or parents) who requires medical treatment in a hospital. This leave is granted based on a medical report that confirms the necessity, including hospitalization details such as admission and discharge dates. The policy specifies different durations and pay conditions depending on whether the treatment is within or outside the employee's city. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]

title: The wage pay by rials or dollars

content: The wage pay by rials or dollars
The wages are paid in Saudi Riyals. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=9]

Can the company fire employees

Yes, the company can terminate an employee's contract under certain conditions. According to the HR policy, the company may terminate an employee's contract if they fail to meet agreed-upon objectives, whether quarterly or annually, as per the Saudi Labor Law. Additionally, termination can occur if the employee is detained by authorities for work-related issues, or if they are convicted of a crime affecting honor or integrity. There are also provisions for termination without compensation under specific circumstances. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=21] [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=67] [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=62]
Can I take volunteer hours if I am in a probation period
According to the HR policy, employees who are still in their probation period are not allowed to participate in volunteer hours. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
What type of leave can I take if I am in probation period

During the probation period, certain types of leave are not included, such as Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha holidays, sick leave, official state holidays, and extended channel leaves. However, the policy does not specify other types of leave that can be taken during the probation period. It is advisable to check directly with your HR team for specific leave options available during this period. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=17]
How many day of the annual leave I can take it to the next year

According to the HR policy, employees are required to take their annual leave within the year it is accrued. The policy does not allow for carrying over annual leave to the next year or receiving a cash equivalent instead. If an employee does not utilize their leave, the company has the right to schedule the annual leave days for them. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
There is educational allowance for level 5
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
There is educational allowance for level 3

Yes, there is an educational allowance for level 3 employees. According to the policy, the allowance for each child is 20,000 SAR. This allowance is granted for children studying from the elementary level up to the completion of high school, provided they do not exceed the age of 18. The allowance is applicable when children are enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, and proof of enrollment must be provided. The allowance is granted for each academic year in the same year, and requests for previous or future academic years are not accepted. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24]
There is nursery allowance for level 5
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
How much I can take for nursery allowance
The nursery allowance for employees is up to 10,000 SAR per year for children aged from 2 months to 6 years. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=25]
Itâ€™s okay if I take nursery allowance if I am a male employee

According to the HR policy, the nursery allowance is specifically granted to female employees for childcare, with a maximum limit of 10,000 SAR per financial year for children aged from two months to six years. Male employees are not eligible for this allowance. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=25]

Can you list all the allowances

Certainly! The allowances available according to the HR policy are:

1. Transportation Allowance
2. Housing Allowance
3. Children's Education Allowance
4. Childcare Allowance for Female Employees
5. Communication Allowance (Internet)
6. Assignment Allowance

How many day I can take for half day

The policy allows employees to take a half-day leave, which is deducted from their annual leave balance. This leave can be taken during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday during Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many day I can take as working remotely
Employees are allowed to work remotely for a maximum of 2 days per week and 5 days per month, except for special cases. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]
Can I take 4 a week
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
What is the support for buying a house ?

The support for buying a house is provided through the Housing Loan Support Program. This program offers employees housing loans once through local banks. The company contributes to the loan by covering interest rates up to 3.5% annually, and it also assists with the down payment up to 10% of the property's value or as determined by the Saudi Central Bank, not exceeding 300,000 SAR. The support is granted based on a point system, and eligibility criteria include being a Saudi national, holding a formal position, and having at least two years of continuous service. The maximum support varies by administrative level, with limits ranging from 1,500,000 SAR to 3,000,000 SAR. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=40-41]
can i take overtime for 6 hours a day

The policy states that the maximum overtime hours allowed on regular days is 3 hours, and on holidays, it is 5 hours. Therefore, you cannot take 6 hours of overtime in a day. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=30]
Whatâ€™s the calculation for overtime

The calculation for overtime compensation is as follows:

1. Employees who are officially assigned to work beyond regular hours, during official holidays, or on weekends are entitled to financial compensation.
2. The compensation is calculated as the hourly wage plus 50% of the basic wage.
3. Alternatively, employees may receive compensatory rest hours, where one hour of overtime work equals one and a half hours of rest. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=30]

Please refer to the policy document for more detailed information or contact your HR department for further assistance.
Iâ€™m eligible for car loan

To be eligible for a car loan, you must meet the following criteria according to the HR policy:

1. You must be employed in a formal position within the organizational structure or in a position approved within workforce plans. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
2. You need to have completed at least the probationary period with the company. Employees in competency development programs (SDP or HiPo) below the administrative level (fifth level) must complete a full year in the program successfully. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
3. The car you intend to purchase must be new, manufactured in the year of contract signing or the year before or after. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
4. You should not be on unpaid leave at the date of loan approval. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
5. The loan amount is equivalent to 48 times the transportation allowance, provided without interest for the purpose of purchasing a car. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=38]
6. The loan is available to employees at the fourth administrative level and above, or those in competency development programs (SDP or HiPo). [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=10]

Please ensure you meet these conditions before applying for the car loan. If you have further questions, feel free to contact your HR department for assistance.

If I have chemo therapy how many day I can take per month
You are entitled to 1 day of paid leave per month for chemotherapy treatment to attend medical appointments. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
How many day I can as appointment leave in a month

Employees are entitled to a maximum of 1 day per month for attending medical appointments related to chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and physical therapy resulting from road accident injuries. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]

What is interest free loan

An interest-free loan, referred to as "Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø¶ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†" in the HR policy, is a financial amount granted to employees who are actively working in the company. This loan is repaid through monthly installments deducted from the employee's salary, without any interest charges. The policy specifies that the deductions for the interest-free loan should not exceed 33% of the total salary, along with other deductions. Additionally, for non-Saudi employees, the end-of-service gratuity balance must cover the requested loan amount. The CEO has the authority to make exceptions to the policy, except for the approved amounts. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=10] [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=37]

title: How many days do i get per month for chemo sessions ...

content: How many days do i get per month for chemo sessions

The policy allows for a maximum of 1 day per month of paid leave for attending medical appointments related to chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and physiotherapy resulting from road accident injuries. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60]
Maximum days for it in a month
The maximum number of days employees can work remotely in a month is 5 days, with a limit of 2 days per week, except in special cases. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=64]
No I mean for the chemo
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question. Please check with your HR team.
For the chemotherapy

The policy grants employees paid leave for attending medical appointments related to chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and physiotherapy resulting from road accident injuries, with a maximum of 1 day per month. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60]

What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward aims to encourage achievement, foster competition, and instill this culture among company employees. It is awarded under the following conditions:

1. Eligibility: It is granted to employees at the third administrative level or below.
2. Criteria: Employees must improve company services, increase revenue, enhance work procedures, or safeguard the company's financial interests.
3. Additional Contributions: It is also awarded for additional work or contributions to achieving significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events.
4. Nomination: Employees are nominated for the reward by the Vice President of the relevant sector.
5. Disciplinary Record: Employees must not have been disciplined in the same year unless the penalty has been expunged.
6. Types of Rewards: The reward can be a thank-you letter, a certificate of appreciation signed by the CEO, a commemorative gift up to 500 SAR, or in-kind gifts within the sector's budget. 

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=28]

title: What is the policy for working remotely?

content: What is the policy for working remotely?

The remote work policy allows employees to work from outside the company's premises during official working hours using approved tools and devices such as mobile phones and laptops. This policy is available to all employees who meet the conditions and requirements for remote work. Employees can work remotely for a maximum of 2 days per week or 5 days per month, except in special cases. Approval from the direct manager is required, and employees must have the necessary equipment to perform their tasks. The company reserves the right to install software on devices used for remote work to ensure adherence to official working hours and cybersecurity requirements. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]

Can I take 4 day for chemo therapy as appointment leave

Based on the HR policy, employees are entitled to paid leave for medical appointments related to chemotherapy, with a maximum of 1 day per month. Therefore, you would not be able to take 4 days as appointment leave for chemotherapy in a single month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
Can you clarify more ?
Could you please clarify your question so I can assist you properly?
There is a leave for a one day ?

Yes, there is a provision for a one-day leave. According to the HR policy, employees are granted a one-day paid leave for attending medical appointments related to chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and physical therapy resulting from road accident injuries. This leave is limited to one day per month. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60]

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60]
Accompany leave ?

Accompany leave is granted to employees to accompany a family member (spouse, children, or parents) who requires medical treatment in a hospital. This leave is based on a medical report confirming the necessity of the accompaniment, including the patient's admission and discharge dates. The policy allows for:

1. **Inside the Kingdom**: The first 30 calendar days are with full pay, followed by the next 45 days at three-quarters pay.
2. **Outside the Kingdom**: The first 45 calendar days are with full pay, followed by the next 60 days at three-quarters pay.

The duration is cumulative within one year, starting from the first day of accompany leave. If it overlaps with official holidays, it is counted as working days according to the medical report. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=60-61]
Accompany leave ?

Accompany leave, as per the HR policy, is granted to employees to accompany a family member (spouse, children, or parents) who requires medical treatment in a hospital. This leave is based on a medical report confirming the necessity of hospitalization, including admission and discharge dates, or for critical medical appointments outside the employee's city. The policy specifies:

1. **Within the Kingdom**: The first 30 calendar days are with full pay, followed by the next 45 days at three-quarters pay.
2. **Outside the Kingdom**: The first 45 calendar days are with full pay, followed by the next 60 days at three-quarters pay.

The duration is calculated cumulatively within a single year starting from the first day of accompany leave. If it overlaps with official holidays, it is counted based on working days according to the medical report. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
What is annual leave

Annual leave is a paid time off that employees are entitled to each year. According to the policy, employees at the fifth administrative level receive 22 working days of paid annual leave per year. Employees at the fourth administrative level and above, who have completed 5 years of service, receive 25 working days per year. Employees must take their annual leave within the year it is accrued and cannot exchange it for cash. They should schedule their leave in coordination with their direct managers. If an employee does not utilize their leave, the company has the right to schedule the annual leave days for them. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]

title: How many day I can take as half day per month

content: How many day I can take as half day per month

The policy allows employees to request a half-day leave, which will be deducted from their annual leave balance. This can be taken either during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday in the month of Ramadan. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many day I can take as working remotely
Employees are allowed to work remotely for a maximum of 2 days per week, totaling 5 days per month, except in special cases. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]
How many short hours is eligible

Employees are eligible for 8 short hours per month to use in emergencies or situations that require delay or early departure, without needing an exception for these hours. Coordination with the direct manager is required, and the reasons for using these hours must be recorded in the company's systems. Approval is needed for any exceptions beyond 8 hours, with the direct manager having the authority to approve up to 4 additional hours, and the manager's manager having the authority to approve another 4 hours. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=56]
Is there leave called hajj leave

Yes, there is a leave called "Hajj Leave." Employees who wish to perform Hajj are granted a fully paid leave for 5 working days, once in their employment, provided they have successfully completed their probation period. This leave should be connected to the Eid al-Adha holiday and can be split before and after the Eid holiday, with a total duration of no less than 10 days and no more than 15 calendar days, including the Eid al-Adha holiday. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many days can I take if I have Dialysis
Employees undergoing dialysis are entitled to have their dialysis days covered by the Human Resources Development Fund, with a maximum of 13 days per month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
Home loan

The home loan support program provides housing loan assistance to employees under specific conditions. The company covers the interest rate up to 3.5% annually, and contributes 10% of the property's value for the down payment, up to SAR 300,000. The maximum support varies by administrative level, with the highest being SAR 3,000,000 for executives. Employees must meet certain criteria, such as being Saudi nationals, having two years of continuous service, and being under 45 years old. Support is granted once a year, subject to budget availability. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=40-41]
Educational allowance

The educational allowance for employees' children is structured as follows:

1. **Eligibility**: The allowance is granted for children studying from primary school up to the end of secondary school, provided they do not exceed 18 years of age. The children must be enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, with proof of enrollment required. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24]

2. **Allowance Amounts**:
   - Executive, Level 1, and Level 2: 25,000 SAR per child.
   - Level 3: 20,000 SAR per child.
   - Level 4: 18,000 SAR per child.

3. **Payment Terms**: The allowance is granted for each academic year within the same year of the academic calendar. Requests for previous or future academic years are not accepted. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24]

4. **Special Conditions**: There is a separate provision for the education and rehabilitation of children with disabilities, with the company covering actual costs up to 18,000 SAR per year per child, not exceeding a total of 36,000 SAR. This applies to Saudi employees' children with disabilities, under specific conditions. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=34]

Please refer to the respective sections in the HR policy document for detailed information and contact HR for further assistance.
Is there educational allowance for Level 5

Yes, there is an educational allowance for employees. According to the policy, the educational allowance is provided for the children of employees studying from elementary to high school, with specific conditions regarding age and school type. However, the document does not specify if Level 5 employees are eligible for this allowance. For detailed eligibility criteria, please refer to the HR team or the specific policy section. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24]

What is Felex

Felex refers to the "Ø§ØªØµØ§Ù„Ø§ØªÙŠ ÙÙ„ÙŠÙƒØ³" program provided by STC, which offers discounted communication services to company employees. The program includes mobile and fixed-line phone services, and the discounts apply to employees within the company and retirees as per the insurance system. The program is linked to the employee's national ID or residency, allowing them to manage services through customer service and the mystc app. The maximum bill limits vary by administrative level, and any costs exceeding these limits are the employee's responsibility. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=36]
Nursery allowance
I couldn't find a specific HR policy that matches your question about nursery allowance. Please check with your HR team.
What is nurseryâ€™s allowance

The nursery allowance policy provides financial support for employees' children enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom. The allowance is granted annually for each child, starting from elementary school until the completion of high school, provided the child does not exceed 18 years of age. The allowance amounts vary based on the employee's administrative level:

1. Executive and first and second levels: 25,000 SAR per child.
2. Third level: 20,000 SAR per child.
3. Fourth level: 18,000 SAR per child.

The allowance is granted for the current academic year, and applications for previous or future academic years are not accepted. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=24]

What is the nursery allowance

The nursery allowance is provided for the children of employees who are studying from elementary to high school, up to the age of 18. The allowance is granted if the children are enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, and proof of enrollment must be submitted. The allowance is given for each academic year within the same school year, and requests for previous or upcoming school years are not accepted. The amount of the allowance per child varies by administrative level:

1. CEO and levels one and two: 25,000 SAR
2. Level three: 20,000 SAR
3. Level four: 18,000 SAR

[Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=24]

What is the educational allowance?

The educational allowance is provided for the children of employees studying from elementary to high school, up to the age of 18. The allowance is granted for children enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, and proof of enrollment must be provided. The amount varies based on the administrative level of the employee:

1. CEO, Level 1, and Level 2: 25,000 SAR per child.
2. Level 3: 20,000 SAR per child.
3. Level 4: 18,000 SAR per child.

The allowance is granted for each academic year within the same year, and requests for previous or future academic years are not accepted. [Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=24]
What is the car loan?

The car loan policy provides financial assistance to employees at the fourth managerial level and above, as well as those in specific development programs (SDP or HiPo), to purchase a car. The loan amount is equivalent to 48 times the transportation allowance and is repaid in monthly installments without interest. Employees must meet certain conditions, such as completing the probation period and agreeing to the terms of the loan. The loan is directly transferred to the employee's bank account, and monthly transportation allowances are deducted until the loan is fully repaid. The company does not cover any additional car-related expenses like insurance or maintenance. Employees can apply for another car loan after repaying half of the current loan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=38]

what is the nursery allowance

The nursery allowance is provided for children of employees who are studying from elementary to high school, with the condition that the child does not exceed 18 years of age. The allowance is granted if the children are enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, and proof of enrollment must be provided. The allowance is given for each academic year during the same year and requests for previous or future academic years are not accepted. The amount of the allowance varies based on the employee's administrative level:

1. Executive and levels one and two: 25,000 SAR per child
2. Level three: 20,000 SAR per child
3. Level four: 18,000 SAR per child

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=24]
what is the nursery allowance

The nursery allowance is provided for children of employees who are studying from elementary to high school, with the condition that the child does not exceed 18 years of age. The allowance is granted if the children are enrolled in private schools within the Kingdom, and proof of enrollment must be provided. The allowance is given for each academic year during the same year and requests for previous or future academic years are not accepted. The amount of the allowance varies based on the employee's administrative level:

1. Executive and levels one and two: 25,000 SAR per child
2. Level three: 20,000 SAR per child
3. Level four: 18,000 SAR per child

[Human_Resource_ Policy.pdf#page=24]

What is the car loan?

The car loan policy provides financial assistance to employees at the fourth managerial level and above, as well as those in specific development programs (SDP or HiPo), to purchase a car. The loan amount is equivalent to 48 times the transportation allowance and is repaid in monthly installments without interest. Employees must meet certain conditions, such as completing the probation period and agreeing to the terms of the loan. The loan is directly transferred to the employee's bank account, and monthly transportation allowances are deducted until the loan is fully repaid. The company does not cover any additional car-related expenses like insurance or maintenance. Employees can apply for another car loan after repaying half of the current loan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=38]

Hey
Hello! How can I assist you with HR-related queries today?
What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward aims to encourage achievement and foster a competitive spirit among company employees. It is granted based on specific criteria:

1. Eligibility: It is awarded to employees at the third administrative level or below.
2. Criteria for Award: 
   - Improvement of company services, revenue increase, or enhancement of work procedures.
   - Additional work or contributions towards achieving significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events.
3. Nomination: Employees are nominated by the Vice President of the relevant sector.
4. Conditions: 
   - The employee must not have been previously disciplined during the year unless the disciplinary action has been expunged.
5. Types of Rewards: 
   - Thank you letter.
   - Certificate of appreciation signed by the CEO.
   - Commemorative gift up to 500 SAR.
   - Non-cash rewards for STC employees who contributed to the company's tasks, subject to approval by the CEO of the unit in STC and the CEO of the company.

For detailed information, refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28].

What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward is designed to encourage achievement and foster a competitive spirit among company employees. It is awarded under specific conditions:

1. Eligibility: It is granted to employees at the third administrative level or below.
2. Criteria: Employees can receive this reward for improving company services, increasing revenue, enhancing work procedures, or safeguarding the company's financial interests.
3. Additional Contributions: It is also awarded for extra work or contributions towards achieving significant or seasonal company goals, including launching new products or participating in important events.
4. Nomination: Employees are nominated by the Vice President of the relevant sector, and the total value of rewards must not exceed the allocated budget.
5. Disciplinary Record: Employees must not have been disciplined during the year unless the disciplinary action has been officially removed.
6. Types of Rewards: The Excellence Reward can include a thank-you letter, a certificate of appreciation signed by the CEO, a commemorative gift worth up to 500 SAR, or in-kind gifts within the sector's budget from company-owned products.

For more detailed information, please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28].

title: What is the policy for working remotely?

content: What is the policy for working remotely?

The remote work policy allows employees to work from outside the office during official working hours using approved tools and devices, such as mobile phones and laptops. Employees can work remotely up to two days a week and five days a month, except in special cases. Requests for remote work must be scheduled and approved in advance by the direct manager. Employees must have a computer to perform their tasks and maintain company data security during remote work. New employees can work remotely after three months, except for executive roles, which can do so after one month. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]

Can I ask you in English?
Yes, you can ask your questions in English, and I will respond accordingly. Please feel free to ask any HR-related questions you have.
What you can tell me regarding the penalties?

The penalties for employees are structured according to the company's disciplinary policy. They include:

1. **Warning**: An initial step to address minor infractions.
2. **Deduction from Daily Wage**: A small percentage deduction from the daily wage for minor violations.
3. **Partial Deduction from Monthly Wage**: Ranges from the equivalent of one day's wage to five days' wages.
4. **Suspension Without Pay**: Temporary removal from work without compensation.
5. **Delay or Denial of Promotion/Annual Raise**: Up to one year delay in promotion or annual salary increase.

These penalties are applied based on the severity of the violation and are outlined in the company's internal regulations and the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development's approved tables of violations and penalties. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=67]
Explain to me the home loan support.

The home loan support program is designed to assist employees with housing loans under specific conditions. Here are the key details:

1. **Eligibility**: 
   - The employee must be a Saudi national.
   - Must hold an official position within the organizational structure or a position approved in the workforce plans.
   - Must have at least two continuous years of service with the company or the STC group.
   - The employee's age should not exceed 45 years at the time of approval for support. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=38]

2. **Support Details**:
   - The company covers up to 3.5% of the annual interest rate on the loan. Any interest above this rate is borne by the employee.
   - The company contributes 10% of the property's value as a down payment, up to a maximum of 300,000 SAR, which is deducted from the employee's salary in deferred monthly installments over the loan period.
   - The company pays the full loan installments (interest and principal) for the sixth year. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=40]

3. **Loan Amount Limits**:
   - The maximum support amount varies by administrative level:
     - CEO and levels one and two: up to 3,000,000 SAR.
     - Level three: up to 2,000,000 SAR.
     - Levels four and five: up to 1,500,000 SAR. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=40]

4. **Special Cases**:
   - Employees in rare specialties or positions may receive direct support upon request, as determined by a committee led by the CEO. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=41]

5. **General Conditions**:
   - The support process is executed once a year, subject to budget availability.
   - The support includes various housing solutions such as residential land, ready housing units, under-construction units, and self-construction. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=41]

6. **Obligations**:
   - Employees must notify the company in case of early loan repayment. Failure to do so allows the company to reclaim the support from the early repayment date to the last support date. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=41]

For more detailed information or specific inquiries, please refer to the HR policy document or contact your HR department.

What is the Excellence Reward?

The Excellence Reward is designed to encourage achievement and foster a culture of competition among company employees. It is awarded under specific conditions:

1. **Eligibility**: The reward is given to employees at the third administrative level or below. It is awarded for improving company services, increasing revenue, enhancing work procedures, or safeguarding the company's financial interests.

2. **Additional Contributions**: Employees who perform additional tasks or contribute to achieving significant or seasonal company goals, such as launching new products or participating in important events, may receive this reward.

3. **Nomination**: Employees are nominated for the reward by the Vice President of the relevant sector. The total value of rewards should not exceed the allocated budget.

4. **Disciplinary Record**: Employees must not have been subject to disciplinary actions during the year unless a decision has been made to erase the penalty.

5. **Types of Rewards**: The types of Excellence Rewards include:
   - A letter of thanks.
   - A certificate of appreciation signed by the company's CEO.
   - A commemorative gift with a maximum value of 500 SAR.
   - In-kind gifts within the sector's budget limits, provided from the company's products calculated at their cost to the company.

For more information, please refer to [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=28].

ÙŠØ±Ø¬Ù‰ ØªÙˆØ¶ÙŠØ­ Ø³Ø¤Ø§Ù„Ùƒ Ù„ÙƒÙŠ Ø£ØªÙ…ÙƒÙ† Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø³Ø§Ø¹Ø¯ØªÙƒ Ø¨Ø¯Ù‚Ø©.
Good morning
Good morning! How can I assist you with HR-related queries today?
There is policy related to the Flex

The policy related to flexible working hours allows employees to choose their arrival and departure times in coordination with their direct manager, as long as they adhere to the company's daily working hours requirements. The flexible working hours start from 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM for arrival. Employees must ensure they meet the daily working hours as specified. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=56]
There is policy related Flex

The flexible working policy allows employees to choose their start and end times, provided they coordinate with their direct manager and adhere to the company's daily working hours policy. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=10]
There is leave called sick leave

The sick leave policy allows an employee, who can prove their illness with a medical report from a company-approved entity, to take sick leave as needed. The reports must be submitted within 5 working days. Sick leave is accumulated annually from the first day of sick leave as follows:

1. The first 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are with full pay.
2. The next 60 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are with three-quarters pay.
3. The following 30 calendar days, whether continuous or intermittent, are without pay.

Medical reports from outside the Kingdom must be certified by the Saudi embassy in the country where the report was issued. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]
How many day I can take as half day

The policy allows employees to request a half-day leave, which is deducted from their annual leave balance. This leave can be taken during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday during Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many day I can take as half day leave

You can take half-day leave, which is deducted from your annual leave balance. It can be taken during the first 4 hours or the last 4 hours of the workday, or during the first 3 hours or the last 3 hours of the workday during Ramadan. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=59]
How many day I can take as working remotely in a year
Employees are allowed to work remotely for a maximum of 2 days per week, which totals up to 5 days per month, except in special cases. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=64]
How many day I can take for annual level if my level is 5
Employees at administrative level 5 are entitled to 22 working days of paid annual leave per year. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=57]
Leave type ?

The types of leave available according to the Human Resource Policy are:

1. Annual Leave
2. Marriage Leave
3. Paternity Leave
4. Maternity Leave
5. Bereavement Leave
6. Iddah Leave
7. Hajj Leave
8. Half-Day Leave
9. Exam Leave
10. Sick Leave
11. Medical Appointment Leave
12. Transfer Leave
13. Eid Al-Fitr and Eid Al-Adha Leave
14. National Holidays Leave
15. Sports and Cultural Participation Leave
16. Language Learning Leave
17. Extended Channels Leave

Please refer to the specific sections in the Human Resource Policy for detailed information on each type of leave. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=5]
Can I take two allowance for my child , the educational and nursery allowance

Is the company accepting any hospital for the sick leave or there specific hospitals?

The company's policy requires that sick leave be supported by a medical report from a healthcare provider approved by the company. This means that not all hospitals may be accepted, and it is essential to ensure that the medical report is from a hospital or medical facility recognized by the company. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=60]

What are the leaves' type

Certainly! The types of leave available are:

1. Annual Leave
2. Marriage Leave
3. Paternity Leave
4. Maternity Leave
5. Bereavement Leave
6. Iddah Leave
7. Pilgrimage Leave
8. Half-Day Leave
9. Examination Leave
10. Sick Leave
11. Medical Appointment Leave
12. Accompanying Leave
13. Exceptional Leave
14. Transfer Leave
15. Eid Al-Fitr and Eid Al-Adha Leave
16. National Holidays Leave
17. Sports and Cultural Participation Leave
18. Language Learning Leave

What is the language leave

The language leave policy allows the company to grant an employee a paid leave for one continuous month for the purpose of learning languages outside the Kingdom, according to the organized procedure for that. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=62]
What is the transportation allowance

The transportation allowance is structured according to the administrative level of employees. Here are the details:

1. Chief Executive Officer and Level 1: Up to 5,000 SAR
2. Level 2: Up to 4,000 SAR
3. Level 3: Up to 3,000 SAR
4. Level 4: Up to 2,000 SAR
5. Level 5: Up to 1,000 SAR

This allowance is provided by the company based on the employee's administrative level. [Human_Resource_Policy.pdf#page=23]
